page.title: 01Introducing Papa Stour.
page.content: Over 100 islands make up the group known as {Shetland},although only 14 of these are inhabited.They lie North East of the Scottish Mainland and are usually misplaced on the B.B.C.weather chart.Otherwise, as Ian McCaskill remarked,"Several million television sets would have to be stood on their sides!" These windswept, treeless islands are nearer to the Danish Faroe Islands and Norway than they are to Edinburgh.The latter(along with the rest of Scotland)is regarded as"sooth"(south). {Papa Stour}is a small island to the West of the Mainland,separated from it by the stretch of water known as {Papa {Sound}(not to be trifled with!). Within an area of 3sq.miles,the 28 inhabitants happily co-exist with several hundred sheep and thousands of sea birds.Now,READ ON .............
